intro: Rhynchelythrum nyassanum, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, while its flowers are clustered in umbels and are usually pink or white. Rhynchelythrum nyassanum is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in some African cultures.
